tasks.task: Build cold frames under a black walnut tree to extend the growing season.
subtasks: Move aside accumulated snow to access the ground.
Allow the sun to expose and dry the construction site.
Cut and arrange boards to form the base rectangles of the cold frames.
Verify levelness of the frame bases, possibly using a reference surface like a deck.
Construct the top sections of the cold frames using 2x2 pine foot sections and secure them.
Attach a substitute panel material (labeled as Tuftex in the video) to the top sections, ensuring good coverage.
Install hinges to allow for opening the cold frames, considering potential reinforcement for durability.
Apply mulch around the base of the cold frames for insulation and weed suppression.

tasks.task: Extend personal kitchen garden through strategic cold frame placement.
subtasks: Consider the location's exposure to southern sun for optimal light.
Plan to expand the cold frame area to eight to ten frames in the long term.
Integrate cold frames into existing garden layout for easy access to herbs and other plants.
